articles.description: A wobbling moon is not dangerous, but one of its effects on the Moon's gravitational pull is the main cause of Earth's tides and will combine with rising sea levels resulting from the planet's warming
articles.content:
"The combination of the Moon's gravitational pull, rising sea levels, and climate change will continue to exacerbate coastal flooding on our coastlines and across the world," he added.
The team unco… [+740 chars]

articles.title: Lunar Eclipse 2021 Highlights: Super Blood Moon dazzles in reddish-orange - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Lunar Eclipse 2021 LIVE Updates: The first total lunar eclipse of 2021 took place on May 26. The Super Flower Blood Moon was due to take place between 2:17 pm as and 7:19 pm as per Indian Standard Timing (IST).

articles.title: Observing meteors: Top 10 tips for the Perseids - EarthSky
articles.description: The 2021 Perseid meteor shower is rising to its peak and many are observing meteors. Here are our best 10 tips for watching this shower, or any other!
articles.content: View at EarthSky Community Photos. | Peter Forister in Charlottesville, Virginia, captured this photo of a meteor and the Milky Way on August 4, 2021. He wrote: “I was out photographing the Milky Way… [+10166 chars]

articles.title: Where has all Mars's water gone? The answer might be well buried - Nature.com
articles.description: A leading theory says that the red planet lost its ancient water to space, but research suggests that Martian minerals sucked up some of it.
articles.content:
Much of the water that once flowed across Mars is now locked up in minerals in the planets rocks.
Geological features, such as channels and shorelines, on Mars show that rivers and oceans covered mu… [+812 chars]
